layer_background_exists: You can use this function to check and see if a background element exists on any given layer. You supply the layer ID (which you get when you create the layer using layer_create()) or the layer name (as a string - this will have a performance impact) and the background element ID (which you get when you create a background element using layer_background_create() or when you use the function layer_background_get_id()) and the function will return either true if the element exists, or false if it does not.
NOTE: This function works within the scope of the current target room - by default the room in which the function is called - which can be set using the function layer_set_target_room().
The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique ID value of the background element to check

{ANY_CODE} var lay_id = layer_get_id("Background_trees");
if layer_background_exists(lay_id, global.TreesBackground)
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}layer_background_destroy(lay_id, global.TreesBackground);
{nbsp_x4}}
The above code checks the layer "Background_trees" to see if the given background element exists and if it does, then it is destroyed (but not the layer).
